location.merchant_description_html: If you’re looking for a break from the tedious rank and file of City Hall, consider Worth Cafe your new lunch-hour oasis. No matter what side of the court you’re on, it’s tough to argue against their Shish Kebab Sandwiches, brimming with fresh choices like grilled Lamb, Chicken, Beef, Salmon or Shrimp. You can also create your own salad from a hearty selection of high quality ingredients like yellow squash, apples and artichoke hearts. When it’s time for closing arguments, they go very smoothly over a hot cup of Hazelnut Coffee. Liberty, justice, and Shish Kebabs for all!

“Boloco Inspired Burritos.” The phrase rattles off Bostonian tongues like the lyrics of Sweet Caroline, but what does it mean? It’s simple. Though the shop proudly serves Classic Mexican Burritos daily, many items are only Mexican in construction. But, the unique flavors--those are inspired by the people, places and ingredients of the of the Boloco community. The delicious deviations speak for themselves: The Caribbean-inspired, mango salsa’d Summer Burrito. The almighty Caesar, a salad sequence that wasn’t inspired in a day. Don’t forget the savory Bangkok Burrito. Thai your tortilla up in peanut sauce, Asian slaw and cucumbers.

Through sincere customer service, fierce flavor and a willingness to take risks, Boloco is pushing the boundaries of what a restaurant can be.
location.name: Boloco - Hanover

location.merchant_description_html: Between Carnegie Hall and the Russian Tea Room, Blue Dog Cafe has become a natural pit stop for Central Park loungers. Farm-fresh eggwiches rule AM strolls while wasabi mayo-topped roast beef sandwiches dominate the PM power picnic lunch. Plus, the place is tapped with highly customizable coffee, fresh-pressed juice and gourmet smoothies for any occasion. The menu may sound familiar, but we promise that their ingredients and attention to detail is extraordinary. As they say on their site, “it shows in everything from the tea to the tarragon chicken.”

On the underground floor of Le Parker Meridien Hotel is the ultra-health conscious Petit Blue Dog Café. While you’re down there, dive deep into a Yellow Submarine Smoothie. It’s blended with bright infusions of mango, passion fruit, a fresh kick of coco water and a velvety dash of vanilla.  When you re-emerge into the world of business, fast food and sunlight, you won’t be phased if you’re armed with to-go goodness. The fresh pressed Glorious Detox juice is totally portable and pairs perfectly with a cranberry-n-cashewed bag of Blue Dog Trail Mix. Where my dogs at??

With more than 20 years of experience, Almeida’s Floral Designs is known for presenting the most meticulously-crafted arrangements. Surprise your love with a bursting bouquet of color, splashed with fine pinks, hair-raising reds and resonant greens. If you’re walking down aisle, the best day of your life deserves the best in fresh, fragrant flowers. From weddings and corporate events to gift baskets and everyday I-love-yous, Almeidas always stays on top of the latest floral trends. Call to schedule a consultation.

James E. Moylan, Philadelphia’s most-trusted chiropractor is now accepting LevelUp at his South 3rd Street office. You can pay with LevelUp when you get a massage, purchase supplements or need to take care of a co-pay. Board certified with 30 years of experience Moylan commonly diagnoses and treats spinal misalignments but also works with patients with chronic neck pain, shoulder discomfort, headaches and sports injuries.

To make an appointment call 267-324-3461. Moylan Chiropractic operates Monday-Wednesday 8:30AM-6PM and Friday 8:30AM-11:30AM.

You know that feeling when one, two or even ten slices of pizza won't do? It's time to re-think pizza. With fresh, made-from-scratch dough and vine-ripened tomato sauce, CiCi's offers 20 buffet-style Ultimate Creation pizzas and an endless amount of pasta, salads and deserts, all for under $6. Pizza loyalists will feel at home with classics like pepperoni and cheese, but why not push the envelope a tad? We're talking BBQ, Buffalo Chicken and Mexican (but shotgun the cinnamon rolls. I'm not sharing.)

If you need a few things from Beacon Hill Variety, you better be toting your Mary Poppins bag. Sure, it always starts with “I just need some water.” But then you see the rainbow of juices, from Naked Juice and Nantucket Nectars to Tropicana’s fall and summer line-up of apple juice and lemonade. Grab a copy of the New York Times for that article your bro-in-law keeps talking about. Snag a pint of Ben & Jerry’s or any type of Chex Mix you could imagine. Beacon Hill Variety: practically perfect in every way.

“Boloco Inspired Burritos.” The phrase rattles off Bostonian tongues like the lyrics of Sweet Caroline, but what does it mean? It’s simple. Though the shop proudly serves Classic Mexican Burritos daily, many items are only Mexican in construction. But, the unique flavors--those are inspired by the people, places and ingredients of the of the Boloco community. The delicious deviations speak for themselves: The Caribbean-inspired, mango salsa’d Summer Burrito. The almighty Caesar, a salad sequence that wasn’t inspired in a day. Don’t forget the savory Bangkok Burrito. Thai your tortilla up in peanut sauce, Asian slaw and cucumbers.

Through sincere customer service, fierce flavor and a willingness to take risks, Boloco is pushing the boundaries of what a restaurant can be.
location.name: Boloco - Berklee

location.merchant_description_html: Having trouble keeping it together? Mexico Au Parc is willing to help you out in a “break you down and build you up” kind of way. Start with an Azteca Burrito, spilling with meat, drizzled in enchilada sauce. It’s one of those “eat what you feel” moments. Once you’ve had a good cry and a hearty burrito, move on. If you can conquer the Super Nachos, your day is lookin’ up. A jagged mountain of tortilla chips is coated with bean boulders, an avalanche of cheese and salsa, guac and meat. Bet you’ll be feeling like a boss after that... no need to thank us. It’s just simple food therapy.

Your epidermis is the biggest organ. So when it’s crying out for lotion love, head straight to Threla. Their handcrafted products are a harmonious blend between nature and science, free of industrial chemicals. And, they’re all made in-store! Feel the cool sensation of a luxurious Pomegranate Body Cream while you relax to the gentle scent of a Soy Candle. For a twist on soft lips, roll up a stick of Sangria Lip Balm. Can’t find the kind of skin tamer you’re looking for? Create your own! Blend oils, creams and delicate scents to your liking, then name it. You’ll be back to your smooth moves in no time.

R U DTD @ DGF? Confused? Let us break it down for ya: are you down to dine at Darn Good Food? By good, we mean “healthy.” Wait! Before you back away, let us warn you of the consequences. Try to escape and we’ll hit you with a Triple Berry Pomegranate Blast Smoothie. If we activate the Asian Noodle Yuba Salad, it’s over. Once your taste buds get tangled up in ginger dressing drizzled jicama and cucumber, you’re as good as ours. Your reward for obeying your hunger? HHH... Healthy Happy Hour, featuring organic wine, groovy tunes, tapas and refreshing Strawberry Thai Basil Lemonade. Get with it.

I try and steer clear of gangs, so when I ran into Jay’s Cheesesteak crew, I knew I was in trouble. The Original Cheesesteak approached me, smelling of onions. “What are you doing on our turf?” I mumbled about finding a good lunch. The Seitan Sandwich flexed its pickles. Garlic Fries felt salted by my response. I searched for a savior... the pineapple-topped Hawaiian Burger? He looks sweet enough. I begged for mercy as they descended on me, forcing me to bite into a cheesesteak. Let’s just say, now I’m the newest member of Jay’s crew. My gang name? Crispy Chicken Wings. Don’t you forget it.

Brighton Landing is home to its very own 225-seat, indoor-outdoor ultra-cafe. Don’t be intimidated, it’s a reasonably priced, smooth-operating lunchtime machine. The menu rotates weekly, flooding your boring brown bag routine with hot entrees, deli delights and gourmet grabs from the grill. Swing by for a morning Starbucks Coffee buzz, saunter in for an afternoon cookie pick-me-up or make your visit a very calculated one...hand rolled sushi day is not to be missed!

The Landing Cafe is open daily from 7AM-3PM.

I’m in constant battle with my nemesis, so when he challenges me to a speed-eating challenge, I’m there. We meet at Blue Dog Kitchen and scan the menu. Six kinds of French Toast. A short stack each from the Build Your Own Pancake list. The size of our order doesn’t ruffle the waitress and the food’s here fast. We start chomping through our inch-thick pancakes but stop almost immediately. Our eyes fill with tears as we raise our napkins in mutual surrender. It’s a story for the ages: breakfast brought us together. We’ll be staying for lunch.

I enter Chiso Restaurant with the usual vegetarian expectation: cucumber roll. But my world’s turned upside down. The small appetizers, or Ippin, alone have enough meat-free choices for me to feast for days, and I haven’t even seen the sushi! MI feel faint. Luckily, my fish-loving friend manages to take over. Before I know it, my mouth’s filled with pickled plum and kampyo gourd. My pal’s silenced by the Roanna Roll, a scallop-crab-tobiko triple threat. World’s quietest dinner. More, please.

Though Ballard Brothers is swimming with seafood of the fried variety, the most coveted catch is the Cajun-style blackened salmon sandwich, served with a haul of French Fries. This fresh, flavorful fish embodies the perfect ratio of crisp crust and tender fillet. And, don’t be alarmed...tableside trafficking is normal. The tartar sauce has been known to reduce even the classiest customer to smuggler status. The tangy addiction is delicious on everything from popcorn shrimp to fish n’ chips.

Ballard Brothers Seafood even has its own dedicated lot for parking. The perfect storm of dinner conditions indeed.
